subject: mathematics
question_text: A school needs to buy 240 notebooks for an upcoming project. The notebooks are sold in packs of 12, and each pack costs $15. If the school buys more than 200 notebooks, they receive a 10% discount on the total price. How much will the school pay for the notebooks?
explanation: First find how many packs are needed: 240 ÷ 12 = 20 packs. The regular cost is 20 × $15 = $300. Because more than 200 notebooks are bought, a 10% discount applies: 10% of $300 = $30. Subtract the discount: $300 - $30 = $270. So the school pays $270.
